note.p: Death: Norfolk House, St James's Square, Westminster (02 April 1701)
Education: Magdalen College, Oxford; MA (1668), DCL (1684)

Career: Constable of Windsor Castle (1682); Lord Lieutenant of Berkshire and Surrey (1682); High Steward of Windsor (1683); Lord Lieutenant of Norfolk (1683-death); High Steward of Lynn and of Norwich Cathedral (1684-death); Colonel of a regiment of foot (1685-1686, 1689); travelled to France and Flanders (1688); attended William III to Holland (1691); Commissioner of Greenwich Hospital (1695); died of apoplexy
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; Hunter; Foster; GEC

Notes: DNB (somewhat confusingly) states that from 1678 until 1684 (when he succeeded his father as Duke of Norfolk) he was styled Earl of Arundel, but was summoned to parliament as Baron Mowbray on 27 Jan 1679.
